sub_title: Managing Director at Hinterland Management | seasoned Non-Executive Director & C-level Executive
summary:
Maarten Gnoth is a seasoned Non-Executive Director and C-level Executive and is the founder and Managing Director of Hinterland Management (www.hinterland-management.com). Maarten is focusing on sustainable investment management based on biomass, bio-energy, torrefaction & biochar and other renewables to support companies, investors and assets owners in OECD and emerging markets. 

Maarten has 25 years of experience in sustainability, international business development and consultancy in renewable energy, biomass and in start-ups of SME enterprises in emerging countries. He is an expert in biomass to market including torrefaction, biochar, bioenergy, co-firing, biomass supply chain management, biomass (wood and agri-residues) processing including wood pelletization as well as in environmental and social responsibility within the energy sector. Experienced in stakeholder management and M&A finance and joint-venture development with Board positions held in various joint ventures and foundations. Experienced Director in two industrial pellet plants and a wood chipping facility.

Maarten has a background in the international energy sector, previously held positions as CCO in a European bioenergy group (torrefaction, biochar, bioenergy heat & power and biogas) and as manager Business Development Biomass and Sustainable Development at ENGIE and various directorship, business development and consultancy positions. His bioenergy business development track record has been focused on Africa and APAC. 

Proven ability to initiate and evaluate projects in emerging markets on technological, financial, economic and social aspects. Track record in business development, investment and senior management and proven insight in operations. Language fluency in Dutch and English with communication ability in French and German.

treasury_media.title: Article Hinterland Management in Bioenergy Insight Sep-Oct 2022.pdf
treasury_media.description:
"Towards bankability for wood pelletisation" focusing on Africa and APAC. This article published in Bioenergy Insight in the Sept-Oct 2022 issue. 

The point has been made that one of the biggest issues for wood pelletisation is the lack of a continuous flow of available, sustainable, applicable and affordable feedstock.

Main takeaway: If you have managed your feedstock, if you have controlled your feedstock, you are already halfway to structuring your pellet facility towards bankability.

treasury_media.description: Together with the trade publication Bioenergy International, World Bioenergy Association organised a webinar on ‘Pellet plants in developing economies – a prerequisite for advanced biomass cooking’. Project developers from Africa, Asia and Latin...

treasury_media.title: Bio Markets Asia 2015 Maarten Gnoth presentation
Creating a sustainable biomass supply chain in mozambique   maarten gnoth gdf suez
treasury_media.description:
Commercially available solid biomass of current geographic origins likely to reach full potential in the future

Incremental demand likely to be covered by biomass from developing countries

Availability of competitively priced and sustainable biomass from these countries is currently low

GDFSUEZ and Solidaridad work together since 2008 to develop basic elements for a sustainable biomass supply chain from Mozambique

Approach:

addressing and solving uncertainties to reduce risk profile and build viable business cases for Triple bottom line torrefied biomass supply chain from Mozambique

Development of a certified, sustainable (triple bottom line) biomass supply chain from agricultural by products and short rotation coppiced trees from smallholder producers in Mozambique, and evaluation of the feasibility of torrefaction under Mozambican circumstances.

Two business cases will be developed:

1. Local-to-local supply chain (sustainable charcoal for local application): stepping stone model and learning vehicle

2. Export supply chain (large volumes export commodity for biopower generation): hypothetical - based on some actual building blocks

For local to local, encroacher bamboo, next to eucalyptus and sawdust will be used as feedstock. 

For export, encroacher bamboo will be used.

The feedstock and business concept will be according full sustainability guidelines including sustainability assessment.

organizations.name: Renewable Heat & Power / Plantation Energy Australia
Pacific BioEnergy Prince George Limited Partnership

profile_positions.description:
Hinterland is a bespoke sustainable investment development and management enterprise supporting companies, investors and asset owners in maximizing their impact and sustainable business value in developing countries and emerging markets as well as in OECD countries. Hinterland brings added value solutions to its international clients throughout the development, investment and operational management period focusing on biomass, bio-energy and other renewable energy technologies. Bespoke expertise in biomass to energy including torrefaction (pyrolysis), biochar, advanced biomass clean cooking, decentralized biomass energy (power, heat and steam), power plant co-firing, biomass supply chain management, biomass (wood and agri-residues) processing including wood pelletization as well as in environmental and social responsibility within the energy sector. Experienced in stakeholder management and M&A finance and joint-venture development.

Added value comprises amongst others a tailored Due Diligence assessment and designing and implementing an adapted risk mitigation strategy during the development and investment phase and management and operational oversight during the operational phase.

Hinterland is also addressing biomass sustainability including governance and stakeholder management for its clients.

profile_positions.description: As Senior Advisor out of Hinterland management provide expertise and support to Indufor on biomass to energy, biomass (processing) and biomass supply chains.

profile_positions.description: As Senior Consultant out of Hinterland management provide support to AWR Lloyd's  executive team in relation to the origination, management and execution of consulting and transaction advisory services for assets, ventures and projects in the energy, infrastructure, biomass to energy, biomass and biomass supply chains in the Asia-Pacific region.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description: Through the acquisition and management of forest concessions in Southeast Asia, Syngenera (www.syngenera.com) promotes the conservation of standing forests, cultivation of sustainable biomass and innovation with corporate customers and local communities to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and a low-carbon economy.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor

profile_positions.description:
Perpetual Next was founded in June, 2019 by Dutch entrepreneurs with an international investment scope. The company provides access to predominantly institutional investors with long-term investment horizons in the field of sustainable energy and circular economy.

Perpetual Next offers best-in-class technology for upcycling undervalued organic residue streams into high value added products.

Perpetual Next operates it's own heat and power plants, and is extending it's asset portfolio on heating in Europe and it's proprietary technology, Next-torrefaction.

Advising Perpetual Next on strategy, sales, sustainability, network, business Development and feedstock management

profile_positions.title: Non-Executive Director, Member of the Board of Directors & Non-Executive Director at Ecanco Canada

profile_positions.description:
Identify, qualify, and secure business opportunities, coordinate business generation activities, and develop customised targets sales strategies, resulting in a portfolio of solid biomass upstream developments. Build business relationships with current and potential clients throughout Southern Europe, Africa, South American, North America, and Southeast Asia. Manage ENGIE’s international partnerships and investments in biomass production and sustainability initiatives. Understand client needs and offer solutions and support for international partnerships and investments. Explore potential rerouting and partial replacement supply for existing biomass supply contracts to manage strategic biomass supply and purchase relations and coordinate improvements in biomass supply.

> Optimized biomass wood pellet portfolio operations by initiating corporate approval, including credit, legal, fiscal, financing, technical, insurance, ethics, and governance, as well as financing, including equity, debt, convertible bond, and bridge financing of biomass upstream JV’s and investments. 

> Successfully secured two Joint Venture investments while providing due diligence and funding, including file structuring and propositions.

> Co-founded sustainable biomass foundations, enhanced the Green Gold Label certification scheme, and developed the governance process.
profile_positions.title: Manager Business Development - Biomass Upstream
